entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing: China’s Overwhelmed Hospitals
entries.description: Also, Ukraine is fighting to retake a city in the Donbas.

entries.title: Airline Meltdowns in Recent History
entries.description: Flight delays and cancellations over the holiday weekend have left thousands of passengers stranded. Here’s a look at a few other notable episodes like it in recent memory.

entries.title: Lukashenko and Putin Affirm Their Close Ties Without Mention of Ukraine
entries.description: Their meeting could add to fears that Moscow will try to draw Belarus, Ukraine’s northern neighbor, more directly into the war.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Battered Economy Leaves It More Reliant on Foreign Aid.
entries.description: Unable to roll over debt accumulated before the war, Ukraine has paid investors more than it has collected this year, the Central Bank says.

entries.title: Ukraine Pushes to Recapture City in Hotly Contested Northern Luhansk
entries.description: Kyiv’s campaign to take back Kreminna began in the autumn. Russia controls most of the Luhansk region, one of four it illegally annexed in October.

entries.title: Navalny Accuses Russian Prison Authorities of Using His Health as a Tool to Put Pressure on Him
entries.description: The jailed Russian opposition leader said that he had been injected with unknown medication and accused the authorities of withholding his medical records.

entries.title: Lee Myung-bak, South Korean Ex-President, Receives Pardon
entries.description: The action by the current president, Yoon Suk Yeol, will release Mr. Lee from a 17-year sentence for bribery and embezzlement and nullify the enormous fines he owed.

entries.title: Stories You Might Have Missed in 2022
entries.description: Today we share stories that stood out to our editors but that you might have missed.

entries.title: ‘Tragic Battle’: On the Front Lines of China’s Covid Crisis
entries.description: Medical staff are outnumbered and working sick as the nation’s health care system buckles under the strain of a spiraling crisis.

entries.title: Nicaragua no era un país de emigrantes. Ahora la historia es distinta
entries.description: Cientos de miles de nicaragüenses han huido de su país en los últimos años, para escapar de la pobreza y la represión de un gobierno cada vez más autoritario.

entries.title: Nicaraguans Join the Mass of People Migrating to the U.S.
entries.description: Hundreds of thousands of Nicaraguans have fled their country in recent years, escaping poverty and repression under an increasingly authoritarian government.

entries.title: You’re Going to Need a Smaller Boat: Island Hopping in the Grenadines
entries.description: Forget about flying if you want to visit many of these stunning specks of land sprinkled across the Caribbean. Hop on a sailboat or a ferry, or you can always swim.

entries.title: The Webb Telescope Is Just Getting Started
entries.description: The first scientific results are coming in, and the $10 billion instrument is working even better than astronomers had dared to hope.

entries.title: Epidemics That Weren’t: How Countries Shut Down Recent Outbreaks
entries.description: Some of the most fragile health systems in the world can teach us ways to respond to public health threats early and effectively.

entries.title: Ryazan, Home of Elite Russian Unit, Still Supports Ukraine War
entries.description: Ryazan, not far from Moscow, regularly sends young men off to fight. Some are now buried in the local cemetery, but there is no surge of outrage against Russian leaders.
